text: Decent aromas and flavors of bready malt, burnt sugar and some spice. Nice copper brown color. Medium weight and somewhat smooth.

12 oz bottle. Deep amber color with an average sized beige head. Aroma is of toffee, peanut brittle, raisin, fig, malt, graham cracker and some earthy notes. Taste is of roasted malts, toffee, caramel, light butterscotch, raisin bread, and chocolate with a creamy smooth medium body.
Draft at the Gingerman.  Reddish brown in color, very muddy look, thinner tan head. The smell is slight hops, sweet, caramel, watery, and malts.  The taste is the same as the smell.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2015 11/15 rerate.  draft at square burger in Mck.  remained at 3.8.  bumped aroma - this has a unique aroma and flavor that I cant place - some said graham crackers??  definitely has a unique aroma/taste.  not as much chocolate but a malty smooth drink  I am a fandraft at gingerman plano - new style for me; DAMN that was good - dark pour with ruby edges taste was malty sweet; very silky 4 on palate and call me crazy but there was a chalky chocolate flavor at end - had to ask if this was a bock or stout?   actually seemed like a cross between the two.  note to self: drink more Fanconia...
Brown and cloudy with a good head.  Taste is very smooth with toasted malt and not much bitterness.  I went back for more over this and it may be my fave Franconia brew.
draft, dark muddy brown with no foam, aroma of light roasted nuts with similar flavor, smooth finish

Draft @ Gingerdude, Houston .. . Pours a dark molasses brown, light foam, very sparse lacing .. . light burnt caramel and wet bark in the nose .. . way below Franconias usually high achievements.. . onslows good in a crisis ..

On tap at the Holy Grail.  Poured a clear, dark amber body topped with a lasting head leaving some lacing.  Aromas of dark malts, plums/prunes and sweet concord grape juice.  Flavors were medium sweetness (toffee), nutty.  Short, dry finish.  Medium mouthfeel with soft, active carbonation.
Dark brown amber tint. Nice off-white head. Dry, maple, sugary aroma. Nice carmel flavor. Deliciously bad. Thick texture and palate-coating feel. Nice fizzy finishimng bite.
(Draught)  Pours a clear mahogany body with a small beige head.  Aroma of caramel, raisins, light vinous, brown sugar, and plum.  Flavor of caramel, chocolate, brown sugar, and toasted grain.

Smells great. Caramel, brown sugar, some filet mignon. 
Tastes the same. Very warm. Very delicious. Great beer for the cold weather. Drink with smores.

(draught at Dallas Gingerman) clear rich amber/ruby with ring of creamy tan bubbles. Nose of raisin bread, freshly milled grain, and other dark fruit. Taste of raisin, grainy bread, decent sweet malt bite, and toasty. Medium to thin creamy body with tingly carbonation. Long duration. Earlier Rating: 11/3/2009 Total Score: 3.7(draught) pours clearish brown with ruby hints and nice creamy head. Nose of toasted grain, chocolate and dark fruit. Taste is roasted grains with nice sweet component, unsweetened chocolate thats not bitter and a creamy toasted finish. This stuff is really good and highly drinkable as it has no off flavors. Franconias best yet.

Enjoyed at the monthly beer dinner at The Holy Grail in Plano, TX.  Dark brown pour with a thick foamy head.  Aroma is sweet and malty.  Taste is creamy, with notes of brown sugar and dark fruits.  One of Franconias better offerings.
Sweet malt nose. Perhaps a little bit too sweet in the mouth, but a texture that is silky and divine.
On tap, deep amber with a cream head.  Nose is toffee, sweet fruits, bready malts.  Semi thick palate, huge fruity malts upfront, followed by the toffee and caramel in the finish.
On tap. Dark ruby pour with a small head. Aroma is copper, grain, dates, raisins and plums. Flavor is raisins, dark fruits, copper, some bitterness, roast, light coffee. Nice carbonation.

On tap at the Gingerman in Dallas.

Beer pours dark brown with a head that is light tan/beige. The aroma is caramel and toffee, with a little bit of dark fruit as well. The flavor follows the aroma, with caramel malts, roasted malts and a little chocolate flavor. The mouthfeel is medium thickness and is very creamy. A very good beer, the best I have had from Franconia. This is an extremely drinkable, flavorful bock.

on tap at banters in Denton. poured dark brown with ruby highlights and a dark beige head. aroma was roasted grains, earthy spice, grains, fruity notes. flavor was earthy, fruity, grains, and some honey. body was medium with high carbonation. dennis is a great brewer and he producer another solid brew.
On tap at the Fort Worth Gingerman.  Roasted malt aroma.  Flavor is malts, dark fruit, and sweet spice.  Creamy.

On tap. Pours with a deep brown body with red highlights and a long lasting tan head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, creamer, raisins, brown sugar  and prunes. Taste is wheat, toffee, flan, and rum raisin ice cream on the finish. Decently bitter and a lingering chocolate and vinous finish. Creamy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2009 Special tap at the Gman FW. Dark red cherry pour. Smells mainly of sweet malts. Has some aged fruit like sweet grape or black cherry but only a hint. Taste has an upfront tingle. A dry, chalky feel also fills in the taste. Finish continues the dryness with a tad bit of bitter dark malts. An interesting take on the German bock. Would like the sweetness in the aroma to continue through the taste.  Thanks to Matt for letting me try this.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2009 On tap at Franconia Brewery. Pours a very nice looking dark brown with red hues and thick, creamy tan head. Aroma of rich malt and honey, caramel and faint toast. Flavor is the exactly the same. Mouth feel is medium-heavy body, a little creamy & silky, with medium carbonation. Overall, a warming, tasty treat from Franconia!  Very tasty and different.
